meanings.definition: The quality of being able to adjust to new conditions or situations.
meanings.sent1: Her adaptabilities helped her thrive in the ever-changing workplace.
meanings.sent2: His adaptabilities allowed him to quickly learn new skills for the job.
meanings.sent3: The chameleon's adaptabilities were truly impressive as it changed colors to blend in.
meanings.sent4: Like a chameleon, she showed adaptabilities by seamlessly fitting into any social group.
meanings.sent5: The adaptabilities of the octopus amazed the scientists studying its problem-solving skills.

meanings.definition: The capacity to change or be changed in order to fit or work better in a particular situation.
meanings.sent1: The adaptabilities of the team made them successful in adapting to the new project requirements.
meanings.sent2: The adaptabilities of the software allowed it to be customized for different users.
meanings.sent3: The adaptabilities of the robot were put to the test in the obstacle course.
meanings.sent4: The adaptabilities of the material made it perfect for various weather conditions.
meanings.sent5: The adaptabilities of the plant species ensured their survival in diverse environments.

meanings.definition: The ability to modify one's behavior or thinking in response to different circumstances.
meanings.sent1: His adaptabilities in communication helped him connect with people from different backgrounds.
meanings.sent2: The adaptabilities of the students were evident as they adjusted their study habits for better grades.
meanings.sent3: The adaptabilities of the comedian shone through as he improvised jokes on the spot.
meanings.sent4: She showed adaptabilities in problem-solving by approaching challenges from different angles.
meanings.sent5: The adaptabilities of the leader inspired the team to be more flexible and open-minded.
